subject: RE: [junit] parallel or serial execution of  test methods?
msgSnippet: JUnit s test runners are single-threaded.  Take a look at the source. Ditto for Ant s test runner. Sun and IBM JVM s will execute the tests in opposite orders
messageBody:
JUnit's test runners are single-threaded. Take a look at the source.
Ditto for Ant's test runner.

Sun and IBM JVM's will execute the tests in opposite orders (IIRC)
because of a difference in their reflection implementations.

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: global_explorer [mailto:global_explorer@...]
>
> if i have 3 test methods in my testcase and there are 3
> instances of the testcase created, does the framework execute
> each test method from each instance in parallel or in serial?
>
> ie.
>
> class mytestcase
> {
> testOne();
> testTwo();
> testThree();
> }
>
> if the framework creates 3 instances of mytestcase and calls
> a seperate test method on each...
>
> mytestcase1.testOne();
> mytestcase2.testTwo();
> mytestcase3.testThree();
>
> does the framework execute each in serial or parallel? there
> is no guarantee on the order in which they execute..correct?
